skill.name: enact/dice-roll-rust
skill.description: Roll dice with configurable sides and count - a simple Rust example tool
skill.summary: A Rust-based dice roller with configurable sides and quantity for games and simulations
skill.author: EnactProtocol

security_audit.summary: False positive findings dismissed. Static scanner flagged LCG random number generation as 'weak cryptographic algorithm' and Markdown code fences as 'shell backtick execution'. Both are harmless patterns in this educational dice rolling tool. No actual security risks found.

content.value_statement: Users need random number generation for tabletop gaming and simulations. This skill provides a simple, fast Rust-based dice roller with configurable sides and quantity for any random number need.
actual_capabilities: Roll a single die with any number of sides (2-100)
Roll multiple dice at once (1-100 dice)
Returns individual roll results as an array
Calculates and returns the total sum of all rolls
Provides structured JSON output for easy parsing
limitations: Uses a simple PRNG designed for simulation, not cryptography
Cannot seed the random generator for reproducible results
No support for advanced dice mechanics (exploding dice, drop lowest)

use_cases.title: Tabletop Gaming
use_cases.description: Roll dice for D&D, Pathfinder, or other tabletop RPGs. Generate combat rolls, skill checks, or damage rolls instantly.
use_cases.target_user: Game masters and players who need quick dice rolls

use_cases.title: Statistical Sampling
use_cases.description: Generate random numbers for simulations, experiments, or teaching probability concepts. Multiple dice can model various distributions.

use_cases.title: Game Development
use_cases.description: Test game mechanics by rolling dice in development workflows. Quickly generate random values for prototyping.

prompt_templates.title: D&D Stat Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Roll 4d6 drop lowest for D&D stat generation using enact/dice-roll-rust
prompt_templates.scenario: Generating character stats for tabletop RPGs

prompt_templates.title: Complex Dice Pool
prompt_templates.prompt: Roll {count} {sides}-sided dice and show me each result plus the total
prompt_templates.scenario: Getting detailed results for game mechanics

best_practices: Validate dice parameters before calling the skill to ensure they fall within acceptable ranges
Use the individual roll results array when you need to analyze each die separately
Handle edge cases like single die rolls or maximum dice counts gracefully
anti_patterns: Do not use this for security-critical random values - it uses a simple LCG not suitable for cryptography
Do not confuse documentation code fences with actual shell execution - this tool is safe documentation
Do not expect cryptographic randomness - this is a teaching example using a basic PRNG

faq.question: What dice types are supported?
faq.answer: Any die with 2 to 100 sides is supported. Common types include d4, d6, d8, d10, d12, d20, and d100.

faq.question: How many dice can I roll at once?
faq.answer: You can roll 1 to 100 dice in a single call. Each die is rolled independently.

faq.question: Is the random generation cryptographically secure?
faq.answer: No. This tool uses a simple Linear Congruential Generator designed for educational purposes and games. Do not use for security-sensitive applications.

faq.question: What format does the output use?
faq.answer: The skill returns structured JSON with rolls (array of individual results), total (sum), sides, and count fields.

faq.question: Can I get reproducible results?
faq.answer: No. The random number generator is seeded from system time and cannot be manually seeded for reproducible sequences.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a simple dice rolling utility that performs no file system, network, or system operations beyond generating random numbers.
